Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class Server
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Creates a server to process incoming communications from connected clients and route them to the appropriate client recipient
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) class  Server.ServeAClient
      Inner class designed to manage communications from each individual client that is connected to the server.

    • Field Detail

      • serverLogs

        private javax.swing.JTextArea serverLogs
        The main text box, used to display log information for the server, such as client connect events, updates to clients' user lists, etc.

      • activeClientList

        private java.util.List<Server.ServeAClient> activeClientList
        A list of ServeAClient objects to allow the server to reference the correct client when receiving or transmitting a Communication object.

      • activeUsers

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> activeUsers
        A list of String names for each user who is currently connected to the server. Used to easily transmit updates of new connected users to each connected client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server()
        The default constructor. Initializes the GUI for the Server object and calls the startServer() method.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method. Creates the Server object.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments passed when called via a terminal. Not used in this implementation.

      • startServer

        private void startServer()
        Method to initiate server functionality. Creates a server socket connection and waits for connection requests from clients. Creates a thread pool to handle each individual client connection. Upon connection, displays connection logging information on the serverLogs text box. Creates a new ServeAClient object to handle incoming and outgoing communications between the server and the client. Gives each connecting client a name. Adds each ServeAClient object to the activeClientList for easy referencing. Starts each ServeAClient task. Calls the updateAllClientUserLists method to inform each client of the new client connection.

      • processACommunication

        private void processACommunication​(Communication communication)
        Method to process a Communication object into an appropriate child object of the Communication interface.

        Currently only supports Message objects.
        Parameters:
        communication - The Communication object to be processed

      • routeAMessage

        private void routeAMessage​(Message message)
        Method to route a Message object to its intended recipient client.
        Parameters:
        message - The Message object to be routed.

      • updateAllClientUserLists

        private void updateAllClientUserLists()
        Method to send an updated UserList object to all connected clients. Called anytime a new client connects
